Exemption, in that I am 65 years of age or older, under the age of 16, or I am physically unable to comply. (If physically unable to comply, explain and attach relevant documentation.) 19. Applicants for status as Permanent Residents must establish that they are not excludable from the United States under the following provisions of section 212 of the INA. An applicant who is excludable under a provision of section 212 (a) which may not be waived is ineligible for permanent resident status. An applicant who is excludable under a provision of section 212 (a) which may be waived may, if otherwise eligible, be granted permanent resident status, if an application for waiver on form I-690 is filed and approved. A. Grounds for exclusion which may not be waived: B. Grounds for exclusion which may be waived: Listed by paragraph number of section 212(a); (9) Aliens who have committed or who have been convicted of a crime Listed by paragraph number of section 212 (a); involving moral turpitude (does not include minor traffic violations). (1) Aliens who are mentally retarded. (10) Aliens who have been convicted of two or more offenses for which (2) Aliens who are insane. the aggregate sentences to confinement actually imposed were five years or more. (3) Aliens who have suffered one or more attacks of insanity. (15) Aliens likely to become a public charge. (5) Aliens who are narcotic drug addicts or chronic alcoholics. (27) Aliens who intend to engage in activities prejudicial to the national interests or unlawful activities of a subversive nature. (6) Aliens who are afflicted with any dangerous contagious disease. (28) Aliens who are or at any time have been anarchists, or members of or affiliated with any Communist or other totalitarian party, (7) Aliens who have a physical defect, disease or disability affecting including any subdivision or affiliate thereof. their ability to earn a living.
